alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:37AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sussex, north central Warren and east central Monroe Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 437 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Milford to Dingmans Ferry to Echo Lake. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, Flatbrookville, High Point, Werry Lake, Millbrook, Vernon Valley, Five Points, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Echo Lake, Hainesville, Lake Mohawk, Highland Lake and Hidden Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
